content.description: There is a climb on the face left of Cameron's Wall. The bottom of it is completely encased in bushes and prickers. But you can see a couple of bolts and an obvious line that would take some gear. I have no idea what this goes at, my eye ball says 11+.
content.protection: Couple of bolts and gear. Bolted anchor. Access the top by taking a faint trail to the right from the top of Cameron's Wall to another rock out cropping

content.description:
Left most climb on Cameron's Wall. Climb up the clean streak following old bolts to left side of rock. For TR build a trad anchor in a horizontal crack using a #2 and two #3's. Or alternately there is an old bolt further back that can be used to backup a rhodo anchor 30 ft or so back

11d is what the old topo said. But this climb is probably at least 12
content.protection: 40 year old bolts. Don't clip them

content.description: Right most climb on Cameron's Wall. Stick clip the first bolt and follow the path of least resistance to the top. It's key to hit several of the holds in just the right place. Crux at bolt #3. A really fun climb even if it's a little short
Middle climb on Cameron's Wall. This seems like a bit of a squeeze job and looks to be harder than the two lines that have bolts on them,
content.protection: Nothing other than your inner mojo
